string.text: And how will we get it now?
Yeah? Look at that guy over there.
He's among the stars now.
Yeah? Why me?
Go do it yourself!
Take it easy.\nWe'll think of something.
What do you suggest we do?
Just leave the artifact?
Thing's worth a fortune.\nNever seen the likes of it!
We'll make a killing, bro!
Come on.\nI throw the bolts,
you go into the anomaly.
Your suit's newer. It'll hold.
Quiet.
Someone's here.
Over there!
Is that it?
A real shame.
I thought,\nsince those areas are untouched,
we could've made jackpot.
Okay, here's your cut.
Stay in touch.
Looks like we've got trouble.
We need to get down\nand set up defenses.
You go help at the west entrance,
I go to the east one.
Let's go!
Got it. I'm moving!
The safe's open. The documents are gone!
Commander, the safe's open. The documents are gone!
You go on, stalker.
We'll take care of the rest.
Keep moving.
Do I need to tell you twice or something?
Look at this special snowflake.
Standing around like nobody's business.
Why, hi there, little Axe! We were just waiting for you, brother. Thought you could snatch the case and run around the Zone? Think you could just walk away?
We're not gonna kill you. We'll just take a compensation fee for the case. Oh, and...
... if you get us a gun from the underground, we'll let you go. If not, the axe goes off the handle!
Okay, get out of here.
Hi, stalker. What brings you here?
Thanks for the information.
We'll keep it in mind.\nYou can go.
We need to prepare for the attack.
Just wait, you bastard!
Mortik, some stalker's here to see you.
Says it's urgent. Do I let him in?
Mortik, some stalker's at our doorstep.
Says it's urgent. Do I let him in?
Let him through. Let's see what he wants.
Don't you ever show up here again, you shit!
Chief, I don't see the case. Looks like it's stolen.
God fucking dammit, Vlad!
It must be that stalker!
Shit. The case is history now!
Hey, stalker!
You better stay away from here.
Nothing for you to see here.
Hey, man,\nkeep your distance!
You've no business here.
Stalker, I warned you. Now go.
Don't make me hurt you!
Just you wait, you bastard!
Huh? What?
Hey, go away... Let me sleep, will you?
Stop it. Let me sleep...
815, base here. What's the situation?\nBase, this is 815. All quiet. We're passing the factory. ETA two minutes.\nCopy, 815. You have permission to land.
All you have is surplus from the trader.
I didn't have time
to look for artifacts. Sorry.
Hi there.
I'm confident that bloodsuckers\nshould be classed as psionics.
It's the only way\nto explain their invisibility.
They simply inject it into their victims.
Exactly. In that same report,\nthe professor dubbed the specimen
an evolutionary dead-end\nand genetic garbage.
I just can't trust\nthose outdated studies.
It's about time we conduct new tests
to clear up the matter\nonce and for all.
Imagine bringing a live bloodsucker\ninto the facility.
A chance to find out\neverything about it!
Hm. Sorry, but that's just ridiculous.
Sakharov's reports made it abundantly clear
that their source of invisibility\nis a special slime.
I mean, they did an autopsy!
I doubt our superiors would...
What's with you today? Let them talk. Or else they'll keep complaining that we're being rude and interrupting their work.
Will you shut up already?
You're making my head pound.
They can talk in their office.
The Zone likes things quiet.
Keep yapping\nand some bloodsucker will show up.
Oh, hey, commander!
93, 94, 95... Come on now! You're barely moving. You've had too much stew!
It'd be easier if you'd shut your mouth!
Boys, keep it down, will you?
So we arrive there, and\nthose eggheads freeze and say:
you go first and scout ahead,\nand then we'll place our equipment.
I tell them: we led you to the building,\nnow you're on your own.
Not our concern. Go in by yourselves.
Am I wrong or what?
The scientist says: whoever goes\ninside gets a compensation.
When Alifan heard that, he put\nhis gun aside and went ahead.
I tell him: stop, you idiot! At least throw a bolt!
He was practically there already, but he threw his bolts around.
Everything seemed clear.
I thought to myself: wow, I'm an idiot.\nI would've gotten a nice reward...
could've sent my family something.
And then, bam!
So, he went there.
Turns to us and says:\nit's all right, you can come.
The scientists take one step, and Alifan\nturns to a pile of bones right before us.
We grab them and pull back.\nI tell them: screw you all.
Stay here if you want, but we're leaving.
I mean, what the hell was that?
I think the egghead told us it was a time anomaly.
You walk into one and you age in an instant.
All that's left of him there is his\nbody armor, bones and gun.
Crazy stuff. Oh, heard this one?
We were walking in the Garbage with the scientists...
Pleasant journey to you!
Farewell, brother!
My best respects to an honest man.
What's up, brother?
Sorry if I don't have\nwhat you're looking for.
Come back later.\nI might get a new shipment.
Nice doing business\nwith an honest stalker.
Take your pick, stalker.
What can I do you for?
Got something to sell?
What a lucky day.
So much genetic material!
We certainly have work\nto do today.
Chief, I'm seeing movement.
It's some loner. Heading in our direction.
I have him in my sights.
Stand down. He's with us. I wonder what he wants.
Chief, a pack of dogs is coming at us!
Hello, Zhuravlyov.
What've you got, Zhuravlyov?
Tell me what you need.
I'll contact you if I need anything.
Dismissed.
I'll page you if I need you.
Good luck, boys.\nOur hopes lie with you.
Hey there.
Hey, commander. What's up?
Speak up.
What do you need, friend?
What do you need? Speak.
See you!
Fair journey!
Stay safe!
Bye!
See you soon!
815, this is base. What's the situation?
Base, this is 815. All quiet. We're passing the factory. ETA two minutes.
Copy, 815. You have permission to land.
Zhuravlyov, come see me when you're here. We need to talk.
Young man, I heard you've been looking for me.
I'll be with my squad near the facility.
Come and we'll talk.
Hello. I've researched the notes you brought me.
I'd like to speak with you.
Come to the place where we met yesterday and we'll talk.
Hello, stalker.
Hello, stalker.
How can I assist you?
How can I assist you?
I'm listening, stalker.
I'm listening, stalker.
Until next time.
Until next time.
All the best.
All the best.
Fair journey!
Fair journey!
Bombs? No, no, my dear, it's not a bomb!
That's worse! You don't have to do anything.
Just give me full access to your PDA and put it on the box.
I need two minutes.
I've stabilised the device.
You can now open the cover and disconnect the blocks from each other.
Just disconnect the wires.
Once that's done, the three of you can each take one block.
This way, you'll be more mobile and the device won't be able to hurt you.
You may feel a slight dizziness and pain in the back of your head.
Don't worry, it's a temporary effect.
Once the shipment is delivered, you'll feel better.
I'll be waiting for you at the Cordon.
Remember: you can't be around the blocks for more than eight hours.
So please hurry up!
God, hurry up!
We need to stabilise the unit before things get worse!
Here we go... what the hell... wait a minute?!
Do you want to live? Then do as I say!
Smyshlov, this is Birdie!
Your men shot each other.\nThey're dead, I've got the box.
I've got two stalkers here that claim that they\nknew the guys who carried the cargo.
All right, all right, You've convinced me!
I don't know how to defuse bombs. What do I do?
Hey, old man, wait...
Stalker, this is Turov. I suggest you return the cargo, it belongs to me.
If you don't want any trouble, bring the cargo to my men.
Thank you, Vizier.
Let me have a chat with these people.
Leave one person here\nwhile you rest.
You, young man, don't get so emotional.
Neurons, you know, they don't regenerate.
And you still have to live and live.
If, of course, you make the right decisions.
Finally we're getting specific.\nI don't like verbiage.
Now, in order.
That box, as you put it...
It's nothing more than a prototype mobile psy device.
Be my guest if you want to become a test subject.
So here it is. You've already met my colleague Smyshlov.
We should thank him for stabilising the device.
Actually, he and I have been working on this device for a long time.
But like many scientists, we had different approaches to our business.
Do I make myself clear?
(Sigh)
I was hoping I wouldn't have to explain it on my fingers.
Okay, it's not my first time.
The Brain Scorcher generates psy radiation,\nwhich is harmful to the human body.
Some people just have convulsions,\nsome people lose their minds and some people die.
But who says only the Brain Scorcher or a Controller\ncan generate a psi-field?
Now, professor Smyshlov and I have created\na portable device that generates psy radiation.
But the effects of exposure to this radiation are quite different.
Do you get it now?
You stalkers are such a shallow bunch...
You tell them about this and that, about the prospects...
And they tell you: fire is scary, it burns!
None of you can see any further than your nose.
You have no idea how limitless\nthe possibilities of this project are!
With its help, it would be possible to...
Ah, what am I talking about...
The goal is not only to understand the nature of psy radiation,\nbut also to control it.
To harness this energy for the needs of mankind!
With such a device, any scientist can protect himself\nfrom any threat during research!
Whether it be mutants, zombies or other uninvited guests!
They will be guarded by truly loyal,\ncontrolable armed men.
What for?
To help science build a brighter future!
Of course you can.
You're as sane and\nas clear-headed as possible.
Except...
As I said, Smyshlov and I\ncreated this device together.
I was in charge of the engineering part and he was in charge of the core.
The part without which the device does not function.
During one of the tests, Smyshlov neglected safety procedures and\nwas exposed to the radiation himself.
And now he's obsessed with the idea of me using it for\nselfish and even dangerous purposes.
And that's just the beginning.
Smyshlov's paranoia will\nonly progress from here.
I'm a researcher, after all.
I only want to continue to study psy radiation,
by whatever means necessary.
Your job is to get the documents\nfrom Smyshlov to build the device.
I have the blueprints for the device,
but I don't know how to synthesise its main component.
But at least I know that if something goes\nwrong during the experiments,
and the core of the psy emitter fails...
This will slow me down for months.
Or maybe even forever.
Smyshlov may be a madman,\nbut he's still an outstanding scientist.
I've already tried.
This moron's obsessed with the thought that\nI want to control both humans and mutants with a psy radiation.
I realise you haven't understood\nwhy we started this project yet.
But if you'll help me, I can use the emitter\nto improve Smyshlov's mental health.
After that, working together as before,\nwe will conduct a new round of tests.
So much to understand and have time for...
Mr Birdie!
Actually, before you all go to Smyshlov,\nI need two measurements.
And in this you can help Axe and Cluster.
Okay...
Since you're all so principled, here's what we'll do.
You go and do as I say,\nand you get a good fee in return.
Either that, or Mr Vizier will remember the untimely death\nof his man, which is at Mr Cluster's fault.
And then you can only imagine the consequences.
I already said: we need the measurements.
You'll be measuring the psy radiation.
Here's the measuring device.
First you go to these coordinates\nand measure the first psy field.
These coordinates are also\nwhere an active Controller was last spotted.
You take the measurements there too.
Then you come back to me.
Don't be so dramatic.
Remember: the sooner you start, the sooner you finish.
All the more reason for Vizier to keep an eye on you from afar.
Vizier, return these gentlemen their belongings and weapons.
Well, hello there, D'Artagnan.
I see you've got your musketeers now.\nYou're a crum and a real scum!
I'd put the three of you down\nfor my man, Grinya, and for wasting our time.
But Turov said he still needs you alive,\nso let's go.
Anyone who shows off,\nI'll put a lead artefact in the back of their head.
Any questions?
That's right!
Guys, take their guns away from them.\nThey don't need them.
Huh... Any whim for your money, professor!
Well, what's this doing?
Wherever you look, there are professors everywhere!
Do your institutes not pay you at all?\nwhy the hell you come to our Zone?
I told you that Birdie fella was weird.
The fat-faced bastard...
Damn it...
Are we experimental rats now?
Thanks, but I'd rather burn myself to pink Bloodsuckers with vodka!
I don't care if it's James Phelps or Oliver Phelps.
You know what I mean? You got it?
Professor. What do you need us for?
Let's go our separate ways,\nI don't even know these two.
There we go again...
Turov, I see that these two can handle it,\nplus you've got the Vizier.
Thanks for the story, I'm off!
Oh, man...
Damn, what kind of bad luck is that?
Can we stop beating around the bush?
Will you finally explain to us what you want us to do?
And what the hell is up with this metal box?
Not really.
Didn't you have enough to do with the Brain Scorcher?
And what is the purpose of your project?
I think I've that somewhere else before...
And it sure didn't go as planned.
You never answered one thing, Proffesor.
Why are we here?
Can you give us more concrete answers?
We've already given you your precious device. Can we just go now?
Will your men let us go?
Professor, now you've completely confused me...
You already have the device we brought in.
Why do you need the documents?
So talk to him directly,
you're colleagues, after all!
What if you make up?
Judging by the fact that several people\nhave already died fighting over this thing,
this project would've already been done with.
Wait, what?
We didn't agree to take any measurements with your device.
It's none of our business, you're on your own!
Birdie's right: you have the people for the job.
The hell with you. What do we need to do?
Don't tell me we need to calibrate another thing.
A Controller?!
Just put me out of my misery already,\nit would be far easier that way!
Alright...
Let's just all have a discussion together.
We'll come to an agreement and then we'll go on our own separate ways.
I've had enough of this.
So Smyshlov was right all along:
you don't just need an army of zombies ï¿½ you want more.
And what's the purpose of all of this for you?
Okay, Turov, I'll entertain that idea.
But what's to stop you from taking\ncontrol of living stalkers or mutants with the device?
So that they obediently bring you a bunch of food, water,\nartifacts and do not interfere with your work.
Holy crap...
Doggo can become human? A full human being?
The same as it was before. you know, before the Zone?
No.
Of course, I won't allow people to be turned\ninto stupid tools for someone else's benefit.
Smyshlov! Are you alive?
My feet in my mouth!
You seriously sayin' you can fix the minds of the undead?
Grazed me... I'm good.
Hey, you dumb fuck!
What are ya tryin' to mumble with your jaw?
Can't move...
Alight, but first I'll show you what we've accomplished here\nwhile you've been looking around.
This is a the subject Bobik\nand he will only respond to my commands.
Unfortunately, Bobik can't do anything but\nfollow simple commands.
The brain was too badly damaged by the brain scorcher.
It's a good thing my vestibular system\nis still functioning.
There's no way to cure these poor zombies.
But they can serve science more than once, and in both senses.
We can run psy radiation tests on them
and send samples where,\nstalkers are wary of going.
Also defending scientists during field trials.
Somehow I didn't expect anything else.
What's the point?
You want to go through the same process\nand hope for a different result?
Does that ring any bells?
What the hell is he talking about?
And how did you do that?
This is all very interesting,\nbut let's get back to the point.
I want to get documentation for creating the core\nand its variations.
I promise, in my scientific work I will mention you, Smyshlov, as my colleague.
So the laurels are shared equally.
Vizier, we'll take the professor with us.
Axe, you've been a great help.
So don't get in my way.
You're a tool, only you're\nbeing manipulated differently.
In and out of the Zone.
But you made your own choice.
So, gentlemen stalkers, come in all together\nand put your weapons away.
Oh, that's handy!
Also, they're de jure dead.
I told you, the core is in the way.
Okay, now let's try it again.
Well, there you go. As usual.
I've made some modifications,\nso give it some time.
This is the subject's last memory.
And how I did it, I probably won't tell you.
It's hard to say, young people.
This is an experiment after all...
No, guys, wait.
You've said your word, now I'll do the talking.
Is that what you want?
So that every little knowledgeable engineer\ncan manage hundreds,
maybe thousands of people?
Understand, stalker\nthis is not just about the Zone!
I'm fine.
I'm a little dizzy but\nI feel much better.
How are you young people?
Fantastic!
So, wait a minute, \nwho's your master?
Oh, wait a minute.
Let's talk!
This... it just can't be...
To make the experiment realise itself as a person.
Look...
He's probably not dangerous.
Find him... talk to him...
Everything's fine.
Oh, fucking theatre... Dead man talking!
It... It hurts...
It's dark around here...
The dosimeter's going off the scale here....
Professor...
Thanks for waking me up...
My master... lets you go..
Call us whatever you want..
Soon my master and I will be one and the same..
The master thanks you, Professor...
For not fighting him
and did exactly as he wished.
These two scientists created my master.
He is grateful to them, but he will not serve them.
Don't follow us.
And we won't hurt you.
I'm sorry, Professor...
But I warned you...
